update.description: Camera lens description that will be used by WideAngleCamera Sensor in gazebo
update.title: Camera lens description (Replaces #213)

content.raw:
added description e254664. I put down the **recommended** hfov to be <= PI/2.0 as that's also what ogre's perspective camera is limited to and [wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fisheye_lens) also suggests this. It could go up to PI but it may not be very useful. 

Added [check](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera/diff#Lgazebo/rendering/WideAngleCamera.ccT455) in gazebo.
content.html:
added description e254664. I put down the recommended hfov to be <= PI/2.0 as that's also what ogre's perspective camera is limited to and wikipedia also suggests this. It could go up to PI but it may not be very useful.

Added check in gazebo.

content.raw: Are error messages produced by gazebo? If not, they should be added as well.
content.html: Are error messages produced by gazebo? If not, they should be added as well.

content.raw: Got it. It might be worth it adding a note about this in the description of each element here, so users don't get confused about what's going on like I was. Just briefly mentioning the limitations of each param for each lens type should be enough.
content.html: Got it. It might be worth it adding a note about this in the description of each element here, so users don't get confused about what's going on like I was. Just briefly mentioning the limitations of each param for each lens type should be enough.

content.raw:
You specified too large HFOV for this type of lens. `gnomonical` is a pinhole camera thus HFOV should be <`pi`.
I should probably check such cases and complain into log about it.
So either decrease field of view or change lens type to something else.
content.html: You specified too large HFOV for this type of lens. gnomonical is a pinhole camera thus HFOV should be <pi. I should probably check such cases and complain into log about it. So either decrease field of view or change lens type to something else.

This is the whole description:

        <camera>
          <horizontal_fov>6.2831</horizontal_fov>
          <image>
            <width>320</width>
            <height>240</height>
          </image>
          <clip>
            <near>0.1</near>
            <far>100</far>
          </clip>
          <lens>
            <type>gnomonical</type>
            <scale_to_hfov>false</scale_to_hfov>
            <cutoff_angle>1.9</cutoff_angle>
            <env_texture_size>512</env_texture_size>
            <custom_function>
              <c1>1.05</c1>
              <c2>4</c2>
              <f>1.0</f>
              <fun>tan</fun>
            </custom_function>
          </lens>
        </camera>

content.raw: I'm playing with this param and setting it to 1.9, 2.0, 3.0, etc results in a black image. Is the maximum wrong here or is the problem in the implementation?
content.html: I'm playing with this param and setting it to 1.9, 2.0, 3.0, etc results in a black image. Is the maximum wrong here or is the problem in the implementation?

content.raw: I removed the `advertise` element as I agree it's gazebo specific, [d34cced](https://bitbucket.org/0xb000/sdformat/commits/d34cced23e8072cffc660d5189819f1fe1a13ff3). As @0xb000 mentioned, it controls whether or not to publish lens states. Now the topic will always be created in gazebo and data are only published if there're subscribers.
content.html: I removed the advertise element as I agree it's gazebo specific, d34cced. As @0xb000 mentioned, it controls whether or not to publish lens states. Now the topic will always be created in gazebo and data are only published if there're subscribers.

update.description: Camera lens description that will be used by WideAngleCamera Sensor in gazebo
update.title: Camera lens description (Replaces #213)

content.raw: No, this topic is separate from sensor/topic. This topic is created by the lens element of the camera only if it is required.
content.html: No, this topic is separate from sensor/topic. This topic is created by the lens element of the camera only if it is required.

content.raw:
You are about "advertise" element? If the element is set to true, then this WideAngleCameraSensor instance will create a new topic and publish information about it's state in it.
Or you are about the whole piece of code abowe? This PR comes in a bunch with [#1866 to gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1866/wideangle-camera), and this tutorial [#265](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/265/wideanglecamera), preview [here](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=wide_angle_camera&branch=wideanglecamera).
content.html: You are about "advertise" element? If the element is set to true, then this WideAngleCameraSensor instance will create a new topic and publish information about it's state in it. Or you are about the whole piece of code abowe? This PR comes in a bunch with #1866 to gazebo, and this tutorial #265, preview here.

content.raw: The thing is that wide-angle camera permits such view angles :)
content.html: The thing is that wide-angle camera permits such view angles :)

content.raw: This seems very gazebo specific. Can you describe in more detail what this is for?

content.html: Can you revert this back to the original value?
